001
002package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node;
003
004import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format.IPathFormatter;
005import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IAssemblyInstance;
006import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
007
008import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
009
010import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
011
012/**
013 * A marker interface used to expose root node functionality for an assembly
014 * node that has root information.
015 */
016public interface IRootAssemblyNodeItem extends IAssemblyNodeItem, IFeatureChildNodeItem {
017
018  /**
019   * Get the name of this node.
020   * <p>
021   * This overrides the default behavior using the root name for the assembly.
022   */
023  @Override
024  default QName getQName() {
025    return ObjectUtils.requireNonNull(getDefinition().getRootXmlQName());
026  }
027
028  /**
029   * Get the parent document node item for this root.
030   *
031   * @return the parent document item
032   */
033  @NonNull
034  IDocumentNodeItem getDocumentNodeItem();
035
036  @Override
037  @NonNull
038  default IDocumentNodeItem getParentNodeItem() {
039    return getDocumentNodeItem();
040  }
041
042  @Override
043  default IAssemblyNodeItem getParentContentNodeItem() {
044    // there is no assembly parent
045    return null;
046  }
047
048  @Override
049  default IAssemblyInstance getInstance() {
050    // there is no instance
051    return null;
052  }
053
054  @Override
055  default IRootAssemblyNodeItem getNodeItem() {
056    return this;
057  }
058
059  @Override
060  default int getPosition() {
061    // a root is always in the first position
062    return 1;
063  }
064
065  @Override
066  default String format(@NonNull IPathFormatter formatter) {
067    return formatter.formatRootAssembly(this);
068  }
069}
